definition: towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly

sentences.english: So many foreigners aspire to Chinese culture because of the prosperities in our country.
sentences.chinese: 我们国家欣欣向荣，好多外国人都十分向往中国文化。

sentences.english: Today, China is thriving with a good government and a united people.
sentences.chinese: 今日之中国，政通人和，欣欣向荣。

sentences.english: The exhibition presented a picture of general prosperity in China's economy.
sentences.chinese: 展览会展示了中国经济一片欣欣向荣的景象。

sentences.english: There are shops, cafes, theaters, and people living in refurbished apartments above thriving businesses.
sentences.chinese: 人们住在欣欣向荣的店铺楼上被翻修一新的公寓中。

sentences.english: Summer, the all flowers together opens, embellishing the hilltop a slice of thriving.
sentences.chinese: 夏，百花齐开，点缀山头一片欣欣向荣。

sentences.english: A scene of prosperity spreads out before us.
sentences.chinese: 一派欣欣向荣的景象展现在我们面前。

sentences.english: The tree grows luxuriantly flourishing, the fountain trickle starts to flow.
sentences.chinese: 树木啁欣欣向荣，泉水啊涓涓始流。

sentences.english: IN INDIA, not only the economy is booming; so, it appears, is graft.
sentences.chinese: 在印度，欣欣向荣的不仅是经济，似乎还有贪污。

sentences.english: Tillie is thriving in this enriched environment.
sentences.chinese: 蒂莉在这个欣欣向荣丰富环境。

sentences.english: A well-nourished condition, thriving, prosperous, full, and complete.
sentences.chinese: 被滋养的状态，欣欣向荣，繁荣兴旺，具足和完全。

definition: see 生機盎然|生机盎然[sheng1 ji1 ang4 ran2]
a hundred flowers bloom (idiom); let the arts have free expression
see 生機盎然|生机盎然[sheng1 yi4 ang4 ran2]
full of youthful energy (idiom); vigorous/energetic/a bright spark
becoming more prosperous with each passing day
(in the spring) nature takes on a new look (idiom)
